article_title: Canada auto union Unifor sees progress at Toyota plants, wants more from Fiat Chrysler
article_text:
DETROIT—Canada's largest union is making progress organizing auto workers at Toyota Motor Corp.'s plants in Ontario, but had to delay a vote for representation because of a discrepancy in the number of workers eligible to participate, a top union official said Wednesday.

Unifor President Jerry Dias said the union now has more than 3,000 signed cards from Toyota workers indicating intent to join the union. However, only recently did...
